Comments_List: I developed an understanding of Environmental Justice principles, the administrative process to file Title VI complaints in the environmental context, how civil rights enforcement interacts with environmental injustice, how to file a FOIA, etc.
Environmental injustices in the US and how to assist less-privileged communities fight environmental injustices.

I continued to develop my knowledge of EJ issues. Importantly, the Capstone pushes students to think about EJ not as an abstract or intellectual issue, but as an issue that exists on the ground -- with all the complexity that it entails. I generally gained a great deal of writing, client relationship, research, and background knowledge that'll be useful going forward.
The class exceeded my expectations! Every class lesson was interesting and productive.
It aligned exactly with what I'd heard about Marianne.
I really enjoyed the workshop sessions where we learned and discussed other projects in the class.

I think the primary strengths are (1) Marianne's excellent instruction; and (2) the character of the matters on the Clinic's project list. The only primary weakness is that the second-semester students and first-semester students don't have as many opportunities to meet each other.
I definitely recommend taking the course, but it is a lot of work so be aware of that.
